bill.title: Law enforcement officers; revise how certain benefits become payable.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That When A Law Enforcement Officer Is Injured In The Line Of Duty, And Is Disabled From The Accident, He Or She Shall Not Have To Use Sick Leave Until Said Person Receives Disability Under This Act; To Amend Sections 25-3-93 And 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Who Are Injured By Wound Or Accident In The Line Of Duty Shall Not Be Required To Use Earned Personal Leave Or Major Medical Leave During The Period Of Recovery From The Injury; To Provide That Local Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Who Are Injured By Wound Or Accident In The Line Of Duty Shall Not Be Required To Use Annual Leave, Personal Leave, Sick Leave Or Medical Leave During The Period Of Recovery From The Injury; And For Related Purposes.
